intro: Bauhinia miriamae, commonly known as the Miriamae Bauhinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Bauhinia miriamae is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
